subject: RE: [junit] How can i test a geter or seter?
msgSnippet: hi, Any body has configue Junit with cruise control.. I need to configure Cruise Control with JUnit. Anuj Gupta ... From: STRAYER, JON (AIT)
messageBody:
hi,

Any body has configue Junit with cruise control..

I need to configure Cruise Control with JUnit.


Anuj Gupta

-----Original Message-----
From: STRAYER, JON (AIT) [mailto:jon.strayer@...]
Sent: Friday, December 21, 2001 2:08 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] How can i test a geter or seter?


I think that test case would be the job of whoever made that change. 99% of
the time that change may never be made.

> Currently, there may be nothing that can go wrong with it.
> But, putting a test
> in place will guarantee that if someone comes in and changes
> the implementation
> of the method and begins to return something other than what
> the system is
> expecting the test will break.
> :)
>
> -jason
> --- "STRAYER, JON (AIT)" <jon.strayer@...> wrote:
> > What could go wrong with this getter that is worth a test?
> >
> > >
> > > class A {
> > > private int i;
> > > getI(){
> > > return i;
> > > }
> > > }
> > >
> > > I want test the geter,should i make testcase as a inner class?
> >
>
>
> =====
> -----------------------------------------
> Keep it simple...
> (1 Corinthians 2:2, Galatians 2:20, 6:14)
>
